message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with the problem of hand pose estimation from a single depth image, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV) and robotics (cs.RO). The proposed algorithm uses a CNN architecture for learning hand pose parameters and bone-length scale parameters simultaneously, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of a hybrid forward kinematics layer for estimating 3D joint positions of the hand, which is related to the field of graphics (cs.GR). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CV and cs.RO, followed by cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.GR.
